page.title: 08Shobrooke.
page.content: PENNYMILL EGGS When we went to Pennymill eggs, we met Mr Brooks. There were 17000 chickens. The chickens lay one to two eggs per day. They have two pigs who eat the dead chickens and the broken eggs off the floor. The eggs were put on to a grading machine and sorted into their sizes and sent to all different places. THE POST OFFICE. The owner of the post office is called Mrs Ford. She has worked in the Post Office for 13 years. She sells almost anything, but she sells mostly sweets and newspapers. She opens the Post Office at 9am and closes the Post Office at 5.30pm. The mail is collected twice a day.
